attributes.action: take action so that all NHS hospitals are forced to offer at least one free cycle of IVF for infertile patients, without discrimination of age, geography or income
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In 2005 the Secretary of State, John Reid ordered all NHS hospitals to provide infertile couples between 23-39 with at least one round of FREE IVF treatment.  This was then backed up with a pledge by Tony Blair to end the postcode lottery, to make this fertility treatment readily available in the UK. 
Now nearly three years on, 1 in 6 couples are infertile. Many having exhausted all fertility treatments provided by the NHS,are being denied what could be their last chance to concieve by IVF methods.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
